Posts.Content: May 6, 2008 07:32PM Conbrio wrote: I'm diggin' this topic!  I enjoy reading the rich recipes!!  Makes my mouth water. I'm looking for some tasty low cal, low fat, low sugar recipes.  I enjoyed Dhettish and Laurita's garlic ginger shrimp and "yummy chicken". Here are some things I keep on hand and munch on during the day to keep myself from reaching for the high calorie, high sugar foods: Con's Cole Slaw:  thinly sliced red cabbage thinly sliced red onion thinly sliced jalapenos small pinch of salt apple cider vinegar to taste stays in the fridge for days, crunchy, tasty Con's Spaghetti Sauce: Wash and cut fresh tomatoes, garlic, red onion, mushrooms, bell peppers, celery - place in a bowl - shake on some crushed red pepper, fresh ground pepper and very little salt - coat in olive oil and shake bowl Place above on a foil covered baking sheet at 350 til everything has a roasted look Remove skin off tomatoes and place mushrooms in a big skillet - place the remaining veggies in blender and puree Move to big skillet w/ mushrooms- add Kitchen Basics Chicken Stock, fresh basil and oregano and cook for about an hour on low heat Pour over spaghetti squash or whole wheat pasta Excellent!

Posts.Content: May 14, 2008 12:27AM Conbrio wrote: You are right Shirlann - some healthy, strong women don't often post.  I didn't during my chemo because I read so many entries from women who did not fare as well as myself and I felt to post about how well I was doing would be like rubbing their face in it and would make them feel worse.  I am seeing things differently during my radiation treatment though.  I have had several conversations with women and men at the treatment center who have had positive experiences during their treatments.  I have also had several conversations with women and men who did not.  But these individuals were curious as to what I did different from them.  We talked and shared and some found that simple changes did make them feel better. So - now I post the positives and pray for all of us. I have had no loss of energy during my radiation and I am 26 down with 10 to go.  I exercise everyday, eat fresh fruits and veggies, no dairy, no caffiene, low fat, low sugar.  I splurge one day a week and eat whatever I want. I meditate and spend some time to think of everyone in my life. I stay positive by always remembering those less fortunate than myself.  This works for me.
